title: Can I write 1000 words in 2 hours? - Quora

response.answer_text: I personally would say it depends on what you mean when you say “write” If you are “writing” a paper using your computer or laptop, certainly. You could write well over 1000 words in 2 hours' time. Especially with an imaginative and active mind. I have personally done this many times. However, if you're doing the old school paper and pencil, It may still be possible. Just much less so, in considering a few factors. The speed with which a human hand writes is much slower than typing on a keyboard.The human hand is a living thing filled with muscle and many other complicated things. It can only do an activity like writing for so long before getting so tired it needs to stop. A machine doesn't get tired. A machine is not a living thing.If your mind is not as imaginative, you will take more time trying to come up with what to write. When you ask this question it also depends on if you mean writing a paper/story, or just writing 1000 random words hot off the thinking press.

You might be able to write 1,000 words in 2 hours but that is super fast. And you would likely need to edit and rewrite if it is steam of consciousness. I’ve been writing professionally for 40 years have tons of experience and would be challenged to write 1,000 words of final clean text in 2 hours.

Hey, good morning! Yes, you absolutely can write 1000 words depending on your rate of type (or handwriting). In 2 hours time, you could successfully write 1000 words at a rate of 8.3 words per minute. While the average typing rate is 38–40 words per minute which would take 25–27 minutes to accumulate 1000 words.
